cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest this evening, turning north Wednesday, then north-northeast parallel to the Georgia coast and toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (between Charleston SC and Cape Fear NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core passes slightly closer Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible along the northeast Florida coast including the St. Johns River mouth.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals 3–6 inches with localized higher amounts; flash flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and a slight tornado risk in outer rain bands.
